children.description:
## Closing Summary

**Outcomes:** Implemented milestone gate locking. getLockedNodeIds() BFS helper in db.js derives locked state from dep chain at query time (not stored). `next` excludes locked nodes. `start` rejects with descriptive error naming the blocking milestone. `list` appends [LOCKED] to status. New `locked` command lists all locked nodes + which milestone blocks each. viz.js marks locked:true in telos-data.json. Web viz: gray fill + ðŸ”’ prefix in tree, locked badge in list view, tooltip shows blocking milestone.

**Decisions:** Locked status derived, not stored â€” avoids state sync bugs. BFS traversal handles transitive locking correctly.

**Spawned work:** None.

**Artifacts:** src/db.js, src/cli.js, src/viz.js, web/viz.js, web/index.html. Commit: c01ff92.

notes.text: Andreas analysis (2026-02-27): Current CC cost ~7/day. Max 5x plan = 00/month. Break-even math: 45 turns/5h window Ã— 5x = 225 turns/window Ã— (24/5) windows = ~1080 turns/day capacity vs current 388 turns/day total. Break-even <6 days at current burn rate. Strategic angle: use CC as smart subagent beyond coding tasks (structured analysis, planning, doc processing) to offload inference cost from API. Revisit decision: March 11 (14 days stabilized data).
Decision deferred: cost trend data needed before deciding. Child task added to track 30-day costs. Pro/Max subscription only makes sense if CC usage consistently exceeds break-even threshold.

Audit subagent spec templates: static-first ordering + state scoping
children.description: Review all subagent specs written by Conductor (and patterns in HEARTBEAT.md). Ensure: (1) static instructions/SOPs always precede dynamic context (task params, current state, outputs) â€” cache matches on prefix so mixed ordering kills cache hit rate; (2) specs don't include unnecessary session history or background context â€” scope to active task only. Update spec templates in HEARTBEAT.md and SOUL.md with a static-first rule.

children.title: Ideas & Future Tooling
children.description: Parking lot for tools, integrations, and ideas to evaluate at the right milestone. Not actionable yet.

children.title: Evaluate DOM/log minification pipeline
children.description: Check actual usage: are Atlas or Forge agents injecting raw browser DOMs or large log files into context? If yes (>10k tokens of DOM/log input regularly), assess ROI of building a pre-processor to strip whitespace, boilerplate CSS, and redundant structure before injection. Only build if usage data justifies it.

ideas.title: /ghost Telegram command
ideas.description: When Andreas types /ghost in Telegram, Jared detects the command, passes (1) current session key and (2) the /ghost message_id as anchor to Ghost via sessions_spawn. Ghost calls sessions_history(sessionKey, limit=N) internally to read back from the anchor â€” Ghost decides how much context to consume. Ghost responds as Andreas would. Jared presents as 'ðŸ‘» Ghost: <reply>'. Correction loop updates Ghost MEMORY.md. Trade-offs: Pro: Ghost reads raw messages (preserves tone/texture for impersonation), Ghost controls context window, no Conductor-summary bias. Con: one extra tool call inside Ghost session. Better than inline paste (fewer tokens) and better than summary (higher fidelity).
ideas.rationale: Zero-friction way to invoke Ghost mid-conversation without explaining the full context manually. Feels native to Telegram UX.
ideas.key_decisions: Default limit for sessions_history? Suggest 15-20 messages. Should Ghost read further if conversation references earlier decisions? Yes â€” Ghost's call. Register /ghost in channels.telegram.customCommands for native Telegram menu entry.

ideas.title: CC completion â†’ OpenClaw system message routing
ideas.description: TESTED 2026-02-27: CC can send to any OpenClaw agent session via curl to /tools/invoke. Routing is explicit â€” CC specifies the target sessionKey. Both paths confirmed working: (1) agent:conductor:telegram:direct:29216737 â†’ delivers directly to Andreas Telegram; (2) agent:main:main â†’ Jared relays to Telegram. CC reads gateway token from openclaw.json. No MCP needed for basic routing â€” raw HTTP sufficient. Trade-offs: Pro: works NOW with zero infra changes. Con: gateway token in CC context = security surface; MCP would be cleaner long-term.
ideas.rationale: Unlocks CC as a first-class async subagent, not just a blocking tool call
ideas.key_decisions: RESOLVED: routing is deterministic. Open: should token be passed via env var vs file read? MCP still worth doing for cleaner interface (idea #6).

ideas.title: MCP server wrapping OpenClaw tools for CC access
ideas.description: Build a lightweight MCP server exposing sessions_send, message tool, and cron so CC can call them natively during any task. Turns CC into a full agent capable of cross-agent communication. Trade-offs: Pro: CC becomes fully autonomous agent. Con: MCP server is extra infra to maintain; /tools/invoke HTTP endpoint already exists and may be simpler.
ideas.rationale: Removes the main limitation of CC-as-subagent: no OpenClaw tool access
ideas.key_decisions: MCP vs direct /tools/invoke HTTP? Auth model for MCP? Which tools are highest priority to expose?

ideas.title: CC as general-purpose smart subagent (beyond coding)
ideas.description: Route analysis, planning, structured docs, and heavy reasoning tasks to CC instead of Sonnet API. Leverages Max 5x subscription headroom (~1080 turns/day capacity). Trade-offs: Pro: major cost reduction if Max 5x active; CC has strong reasoning, long context, file access. Con: no OpenClaw tool access natively (addressed by MCP idea); higher warm-up latency; less suited for conversational back-and-forth.
ideas.rationale: Primary cost lever if Max 5x plan is adopted â€” offload inference from API billing to subscription
ideas.key_decisions: Which task types route well to CC? What's the quality delta vs Sonnet for non-coding tasks? How to handle tool-dependent tasks?

ideas.title: MarkdownLM â€” AI coding rules as MCP infrastructure
ideas.description: Treats coding rules as infrastructure via MCP. Define once, enforced across all agents/sessions. Revisit at M1 when Forge reactivates and multi-codebase rule drift becomes real. Currently CLAUDE.md per-repo is sufficient. https://markdownlm.com

ideas.title: OpenClaw SaaS offering
ideas.description: Cloud-hosted version of OpenClaw for teams that don't want to self-host.
ideas.rationale: Reduces friction for new users; recurring revenue model.
ideas.key_decisions: Pricing: per-seat 9/mo; multi-tenant with data isolation

ideas.title: Atlas memory persistence via vector DB
ideas.description: Replace flat MEMORY.md with a vector store for semantic recall across sessions.
ideas.rationale: Better long-term context; enables fuzzy search over past decisions.
ideas.key_decisions: Which vector DB (Qdrant, Chroma, pgvector?); cost vs self-hosted

ideas.title: Telos mobile app
ideas.description: Native mobile app for Telos goal tracking.
ideas.rationale: Considered but web dashboard is sufficient for current use case.
ideas.key_decisions: Rejected â€” too much effort, web is fine
